item.title: Black Forest Cake II
item.description: Indulge in this classic Black Forest Cake II, a luscious chocolate layer cake soaked in kirschwasser and layered with sweet cherry filling and fluffy whipped cream. Its rich flavors and moist texture make it a perfect centerpiece for any celebration or cozy gathering.
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 30 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 40 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 70 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 2/3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup shortening
  • 1 1/2 cups white sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 1/2 cups buttermilk
  • 1/2 cup kirschwasser
  • 1/2 cup butter
  • 3 1/2 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 teaspoon strong brewed coffee
  • 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
  • 2 cups heavy whipping cream
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon kirschwasser
  • 1 (1 ounce) square semisweet chocolate

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8 inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
  2. Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
  3. Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy.
  4. Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until well combined.
  5. Alternately beat in the flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
  6. Pour batter evenly into the prepared pans.
  7. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  8. Cool cakes completely, then remove parchment paper.
  9. Cut each cake layer in half horizontally to make 4 layers total.
  10. Sprinkle each layer evenly with 1/2 cup kirschwasser.
  11. In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy.
  12. Add confectioners' sugar, a pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth. If too thick, add a few teaspoons of cherry juice or milk.
  13. Spread one-third of the buttercream filling on the first cake layer, then top with one-third of the drained cherries.
  14. Repeat spreading filling and cherries on the next two layers.
  15. In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks.
  16. Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
  17. Frost the top and sides of the assembled cake with the whipped cream mixture.
  18. Create chocolate curls by using a potato peeler on the semisweet chocolate square and sprinkle over the cake as garnish.
